title: Have you ever known someone who was over 30 and had never been in a romantic relationship? What was wrong that stopped them? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have . Uhm this person had only had one relationship in life at the time and it wasnt something I would even consider a real relationship in the sense that it was long distance, they only saw each other once a year and they never met each other’s family/parents or visited each other’s home. This went on for a couple years. I dont really understand how or why this person had never had a real relationship. All I can conclude from an outside perspective is that I would not really consider the person a “catch” . This person is not favored in the looks or physique dept, has a dead end job, still lives at home, not very sharp, not very social or driven, and is very immature for his age. So I would not expect anyone to be rushing to be the other half. Also rather religious so I guess somewhat harder to find a partner if you arent putting yourself in situations where you can socialize and meet other people .

Me. 38 years old, never been in a romantic relationship. Tried dating for a while, found it to be the most tedious, boring thing I could possibly be doing with my time. There’s nothing wrong. I just don’t care. I have my friends, I have shit to do, I get annoyed when I don’t have my own space. Why drag myself through the tedious process of dating, losing time and wasting energy that could be better spent on other things, just because society tells us that there’s something “wrong” with us if we’re single?

I do, yes. A friend of mine never dated or had a relationship until he was 30. There really wasn’t anything wrong with him, it just was that way. Then one day, he met someone (at the funeral of his father actually), it was love at first sight. His life changed in a heartbeat, and they now live happily together and have 2 children!
